name: Delete Operation for Two Strings

similar_questions.title: Minimum ASCII Delete Sum for Two Strings

title: Delete Operation for Two Strings
content:
Given two strings word1 and word2, return the minimum number of steps required to make word1 and word2 the same.

In one step, you can delete exactly one character in either string.

 

Example 1:

Input: word1 = "sea", word2 = "eat"
Output: 2
Explanation: You need one step to make "sea" to "ea" and another step to make "eat" to "ea".

Example 2:

Input: word1 = "leetcode", word2 = "etco"
Output: 4

 

Constraints:

  • 1 <= word1.length, word2.length <= 500
  • word1 and word2 consist of only lowercase English letters.

discussion_posts.name: ahmedhibet
discussion_posts.content: Try to use Longest Common Sub-sequence(LCS) algorithm.

discussion_posts.name: surya_vamsi_kodeti
discussion_posts.content: What if I say you already solved this problem ;)

discussion_posts.name: brain_dead_T_T
discussion_posts.content: Life feels so easy when you go with recursion + memoization

discussion_posts.name: Mister_CK
discussion_posts.content:
I recommend doing this one first: 1143. Longest Common Subsequence
Then, you can use your code from that problem to solve this problem with one extra line. 
If you are done with this one, 72. Edit Distance, is only a slight variation on this algorithm.

discussion_posts.name: psidh
discussion_posts.content: ### First ever Dynamic Programming to do it on my own, \nNo LSP, No hints\nI have done little DP in past, but that involved seeing so much from YouTube and struggling. Now it is time to rock in DP

discussion_posts.name: JakhongirMurodov
discussion_posts.content: Count the longest common sub-sequence of two words. \nreturn len(w1) + len(w2) - 2*len_common_sub_sequence

discussion_posts.name: reassurance
discussion_posts.content:
LC has additionally added a new Test Case (2nd last I believe) which is a tricky one.

One thing to watch out is for single character strings ```s``` and ```t```.

Rest is the basic [LCS](https://leetcode.com/problems/longest-common-subsequence/solutions/3942264/beauty-of-lcs/)

Also try out the below questions for a firmer grasp on LCS:

[1035. Uncrossed Lines](https://leetcode.com/problems/uncrossed-lines/)
[1312. Minimum Insertion Steps to Make a String Palindrome](https://leetcode.com/problems/minimum-insertion-steps-to-make-a-string-palindrome/)

discussion_posts.name: kaushal0709
discussion_posts.content:
Layman's approach :  I want to make two strings equal in min delete operations. Hmm...Let's not delete the common characters between both the strings. 

How do I find the longest common set of characters? 
No one : LCS
